New Records: Shohei Ohtani moved closer to becoming the first player in major league history with 50 homers and 50 stolen bases in a season.
Key Match Events: The Dodgers blew a 7-3 lead to beat the Chicago Cubs 10-8.
Tommy Edman homered for the fourth time in 24 hours.
Will Smith doubled off Shawn Armstrong in the seventh and scored on Lux’s single to center, putting the Dodgers back in front, 8-7.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers walked 10 batters, including four by starter Bobby Miller.
The Cubs outscored the Dodgers 16-7 in winning the first two games.
Post-Match Reflections: Max Muncy said, “It was frustrating again, but it’s baseball. Not everything is going to be clicking at the same time,”
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, “Tommy is otherworldly these days,”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers blew a lead for the second straight game.
The Dodgers magic number to clinch the division dropped to 11 after San Diego lost at Seattle.
